properties.title: The Car Rental System sample application

section.name: The Car Rental System sample application
section.p: The car rental system application is one of multiple samples showing what you can do with AndroMDA. In order to get the sources for this sample you are required to download an AndroMDA 3.x distribution.

The model has been designed using the Poseidon case tool. You will find the model inside this file. Open and view this model with Poseidon's community edition, which can be downloaded from Gentleware's web site. Although Poseidon CE is free, not everybody has installed it. Therefore, we have used Poseidon PE to generate an HTML/JPEG representation of the car rental system sample model browsable as HTML.

subsection.name: The Model
subsection.p: The model consists of a package with use cases, explaining what the main actors (users) of the application might be and what they can do with the system. The main actors are an administrator who creates things like cars and types of cars, a customer who reserves cars for certain dates, and a call center who can reserve cars as well as record car accidents. Last, but not least, there are car loan and reception desks who do what their names imply. :-) Each use case has an activity diagram attached to it which explains the message flow of that particular use case.
The rest of the model contains all the design level packages with the class diagrams inside. The design level packages are admins, contracts, customers and inventory.

subsection.name: The Implementation
subsection.p:
This sample has both a hibernate and ejb version, the hibernate version uses Hibernate as its persistence layer and the ejb version uses Entity Beans for its persistence.
Tier Technology Cartridge
Persistence (Hibernate) and Business (Stateless Session EJBs) Hibernate 2.x.y and EJB 2.0 (Stateless Session EJBs) andromda-hibernate-cartridge
Persistence (Entity Beans) and Business (Stateless Session EJBs) EJB 2.0 (Stateless Session and Entity EJBs) andromda-ejb-cartridge
Presentation Struts 1.2.2 andromda-struts-cartridge

subsection.name: Building and Deploying
subsection.p: To build the car rental system, just cd to the andromda distribution's samples/car-rental-system directory and type maven, this will build both EJB and Hibernate versions of the application. You will find both deployable ear files located in samples/car-rental-system/app/hibernate/target and samples/car-rental-system/app/ejb/target respectively.
These ear files can be deployed within a JBoss application server instance (like any typical J2EE application) by dropping the ear files within your $JBOSS_HOME/server/default/deploy directory.

In addition to deploying the ear file for the hibernate version, you'll also need to initialize the database with the hibernate generated DDL. Use the file hibernate-schema-initialize.sql to initialize the database, or hibernate-schema-reinitialize.sql to re-initialize the database. These files can be found in the same directory the hibernate ear file was created (i.e. car-rental-system/app/hibernate/target). To remove the schema you can use hibernate-schema-remove.sql.

Because the application uses the HypersonicSql Database bundled with JBoss, you'll need to make sure you have JBoss running before executing the above SQL scripts. To make it easier to execute these DDL scripts you'll find more scripts within the car-rental-system/app/hibernate/target for just this purpose (initializeSchema.sh/bat, reInitializeSchema.sh/bat and removeSchema.sh/bat) which do what their names imply.

subsection.name: Using
subsection.p: Once the car rental system has been successfully deployed within JBoss (i.e. no exceptions), point your browser to http://localhost:8080/carrental-ejb to start using the application (replace the word ejb by hibernate if you'd like to view the Hibernate version. You will notice that the application comes up in your preferred language (currently available: Brazilian Portuguese, Finnish, and German) or in English if your language is not supported. This is due to the fact that the application uses Struts localized message resources.

You may now begin to explore the application:
Login as an administrator
Create things such as car types, cars and customers
Logout
Login as a customer and reserve the cars created from step 2 car(s) for certain date(s).
Finally, you may start a JDBC browser to have a look at the database tables with their beautiful CMR relationships in the disguise of foreign keys
When you log in as administrator for the first time, the system will prompt you for a new username and password. Please memorize these for the next time you log in.
